===Etymology 1===
<div style="float:right;clear:both;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
[[File:Wakan Sansai Zue - Kaso.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|火鼠}} (''hinezumi'', ''kaso''): [[woodblock]] [[print]] from the ''{{w|Wakan Sansai Zue}}'' ({{lang|ja|[[:ja:w:和漢三才図会|和漢三才図会]]}})]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|ひ|ねずみ|yomi=kun}}
Compound of {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=ひねずみ}} elements {{compound|lang=ja|sort=ひねずみ|火|tr1=hi|t1=fire|鼠|tr2=nezumi|t2=rat, mouse}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kun|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR|ひねずみ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ひねずみ}}

# a {{l|en|fire}}-{{l|en|rat}}: an imaginary {{l|en|creature}} of ancient China resembling a white {{l|en|rat}}, thought to live in the {{l|en|volcano}}es of the {{l|en|South China Sea}} and to have {{l|en|fireproof}} {{l|en|fur}}
#* '''10th century''': ''{{w|The Tale of the Bamboo Cutter}}''
#*: {{lang|ja|唐土にある、'''火鼠'''の裘を給へ}}
#*:: {{lang|ja|もろこしにある、'''ひねずみ'''のかわごろもをたまえ}}
#*:: ''Morokoshi ni aru, '''hinezumi''' no kawagoromo o tamae''
#*::: Get me the fur robe of the '''fire-rat''' in China...
